business.headline: Personal loan for wedding? Why borrowing for the big day needs rethinkingA wedding is a beautiful milestone, but is it worth starting your new life under a mountain of debt? With the rising trend of using personal loans to fund lavish celebrations, it's time to rethink the cost of saying "I do."

Explained: Why India shouldn't lose sleep over Trump's 25% tariffsIndia shouldn't trade its future for short-term calm. Trump's tariff move is more noise than policy. Staying firm now will protect India's strength and choices in the long run.

May consider dividends to citizens: Trump on tariff revenue disbursal plansTrump has signed a new executive order that imposes fresh import tariffs on goods from 69 countries and the European Union, which will come into effect on August 7.

Loan fraud case: ED issues lookout notice against Anil AmbaniA lookout circular has been issued against Anil Ambani at the request of the Enforcement Directorate (ED), preventing him from travelling abroad without court permission.

Anil Ambani faces lookout notice in Rs 3,000-crore loan fraud caseAnil Ambani can now no longer travel outside India without court permission. This comes after a series of crackdowns on his business entities, allegations of fraud against his firms, and a summons issued by a federal agency.
Vandana Vasudevan on how tech is reshaping daily lifeSpeaking with Business Today's Sakshi Batra, OTP Please author Vandana Vasudevan explains how this shift is changing daily routines.

OTP Please! The double-edged sword of digital living: Vandana VasudevanSpeaking with Business Today's Sakshi Batra, OTP Please author Vandana Vasudevan tells how tech has changed how we live, making travel easier for the disabled, food more accessible, and work more flexible. But she warns of fading community bonds, unhealthy habits, and insecure gig jobs. Tech must support life, not replace human connection.

US tariffs will not have significant adverse impact on Indian economy: SourcesThe 25% tariff announced by US President Donald Trump will not have a significant adverse impact on the Indian economy, government sources said.

Elon Musk's Starlink to operate soon in India. Check monthly plansUnion Telecom Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia confirmed that Starlink has been awarded a Unified Licence to launch its satellite internet operations in India.
Sensex closes 586 points lower, Nifty below 25,600; Infosys ends 3% downThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 585.67 points to close at 80,599.91, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 203 points to end at 24,565.35.

CA explains why you should not use FDs as an emergency fundAccording to RBI guidelines, banks can charge up to 0.5% to 1.0% of the interest rate as a penalty if FDs are broken before their maturity period.

Indian interests top priority, no chance of compromising due to US tariffs: SourcesAn official said that the government is closely watching the developments but sees no reason for alarm after the US imposed a 25% tariff on India.

entertainment.headline: Ankita Lokhande appeals to public after house-help's daughter goes missingActor Ankita Lokhande appealed for help after her house-help's daughter and friend disappeared. She stated that an FIR has been registered by the Mumbai police.

Tamannaah on Aaj Ki Raat's fame: Mothers tell me toddlers eat listening to the songActor Tammannah Bhatia talked about the recognition that came with her hit dance number 'Aaj Ki Raat' from 'Stree 2'. She said in an exclusive with The Lallantop that several mothers told her that their child would eat food only if they heard the song.

Dhadak 2 is punch in the gut, Raj Kapoor, Bimal Roy used to do this: Anurag KashyapAnurag Kashyap likend 'Dhadak 2' to films by Raj Kapoor and Bimal Roy, highlighting its social relevance in an Instagram post. He appreciated the cast and crew of the film.

Farah Khan flags fake Instagram profile impersonating her cook Dilip, warns actionFilmmaker Farah Khan, on Sunday, issued a warning against a fake Instagram account impersonating her cook Dilip. The account falsely claimed to be a blogger and used Khan's name.

Kingdom box office Day 3: Vijay Deverakonda's film sees mild recovery on SaturdayActor Vijay Deverakonda's film 'Kingdom' crossed Rs 30 crore nett in India in three days. The film features a star-studded cast and is directed by Gowtam Tinnanuri of 'Jersey' fame.

Hrithik Roshan's moves to Aavan Jaavan light up Internet in viral videoActor Hrithik Roshan's danced to 'War 2' song 'Aavan Jaavan' at an event in Sri Lanka and the video is now going viral. The much-anticipated film 'War 2' will release on August 14.

Saiyaara box office Day 16: Ahaan-Aneet's film sees Saturday growthDirector Mohit Suri's 'Saiyaara' edges closer to Rs 300 crore nett with a strong weekend performance. The film features debutants Aneet Padda and Ahaan Panday in lead roles.

Chalti Ka Naam Gaadi: Madhubala and Kishore's defiant dance of joy amidst shadows'Chalti Ka Naam Gaadi' remains a beloved 1958 Bollywood classic starring Madhubala and Kishore Kumar. The film blends humour, music, and family values, reflecting the spirit of post-independence India.

Tamannaah denies rape of Avantika in Baahubali: It's finding herself through a manActor Tamannaah Bhatia, in an interview with The Lallantop, opened up about the controversial scene featuring her and Prabhas in 'Baahubali: The Beginning'. She explained the thought process behind the particular sequence and SS Rajamouli's vision.

Son of Sardaar 2 vs Dhadak 2 box office Day 2: Ajay Devgn's film leads the race'Son of Sardaar 2' emerged as the audience's preferred choice over 'Dhadak 2' despite mixed reviews. Both films were released on Friday. The Ajay Devgn-starrer earned Rs 7.5 crore India nett, while the Siddhant Chaturvedi and Tripti Dimri film collected Rs 3.7 crore India nett on Day 2.

Rajinikanth roasts Coolie director, his self-deprecating jokes win hearts at eventSuperstar Rajinikanth is known for his public speaking skills. At the 'Coolie' audio launch, he made everyone laugh out loud while appreciating and complimenting the cast and crew of the film.

Veteran Tamil actor and comedian Madhan Bob dies at 71 after cancer battleMadhan Bob, renowned Tamil actor and comedian, died at 71 in Chennai. He was undergoing cancer treatment for the past few years.

Gauri Khan, Suhana celebrate SRK, Rani and Karan Johar's National Award winShah Rukh Khan won his first National Award for his performance in 'Jawan'. His wife, Gauri Khan and daughter Suhana celebrated SRK, Rani Mukerji and Karan Johar's win at the 71st National Film Awards.

Film body warns Kartik Aaryan over event by Pakistani restaurant, actor denies linkActor Kartik Aaryan's team has clarified that he is not associated with the event organised by a Pakistani-owned restaurant. The response came after Federation of Western lndia Cine Employees (FWICE) warned him against the same.

Kollywood's 1st Rs 1,000 crore loading: Internet on Rajinikanth's Coolie trailerThe trailer of director Lokesh Kanagaraj's 'Coolie' has been released amid much anticipation. Social media users have predicted that the Rajinikanth-starrer could be Kollywood's first Rs 1,000 crore film. The film, featuring an ensemble cast, is set to release on August 14.

Coolie audio launch: Crowd erupts as Rajinikanth enters venue, Aamir Khan hugs himSuperstar Rajinikanth received a rousing welcome at the Nehru Indoor Stadium in Chennai on Saturday. He greeted the cast and crew and hugged them as he welcomed them for the event.

Coolie trailer: Rajinikanth, Aamir Khan, Nagarjuna go all guns blazingThe trailer for 'Coolie', featuring superstar Rajinikanth, was unveiled in Chennai on Saturday. Directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, the film revolves around a gold smuggler. The highly anticipated film will release on August 14 and clash with 'War 2' at the box office.

Vaibhavi Merchant wins National Award, says Dhindora Baje Re was always specialChoreographer Vaibhavi Merchant said the song 'Dhindora Baje Re' from 'Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahaani' was always special. She further expressed that winning the National Award for the song's choreography has infused a lot of life back into her work.

Same same but different: How Rajinikanth's Coolie poster sparks plagiarism buzzSocial media users have compared 'Coolie' posters to Hollywood films like 'Madame Web' and 'Glass'. The Rajinikanth-starrer is set for release on August 14, with its trailer launching today in Chennai.

general news.headline: Jaws broken, spine fractured: Army officer thrashes SpiceJet staff over extra feeA senior Army officer allegedly assaulted four SpiceJet employees at Srinagar airport over a cabin baggage dispute, causing serious injuries including a spinal fracture and jaw damage.

Dharmasthala mass burial case: RTI revelations trigger shocking testimoniesRTI revelations exposing the deletion of death records by Belthangady police have triggered fresh allegations of illegal mass burials, with an eyewitness filing a formal complaint to the SIT. The case, linked to suspected cover-ups and destroyed evidence, may soon lead to exhumation and a full-scale investigation.
Chidambaram flags 6.5 lakh voter addition in Tamil Nadu amid Bihar revision rowRajya Sabha MP P Chidambaram accused the Election Commission of trying to change the 'electoral character' of states.

5th Test Day 4 Live: Duckett and Pope hold ground for EnglandENG vs IND, 5th Test Day 4 Live Score and Updates: Day 4 at The Oval began with England cautiously resuming their record chase. Ben Duckett and Ollie Pope held firm early on, but India, led by Shubman Gill, will count on their in-from pace ace Mohammed Siraj for breakthroughs.

Can Indian bananas beat back the colonial Cavendish?The British-origin Cavendish banana is invading markets across the world and has become the dominant variety sold everywhere. Even in India, Cavendish and its sub-varieties have gained territory, making native varieties like Bihar's Chinia and Assam's Bhimkol harder to spot. From Tamil Nadu to the Northeast, the native kadali phalams are putting up a tough fight. Will desi bananas be able to beat back the colonial Cavendish?

4 of Indian-origin family missing in US for 5 days found deadThe four senior citizens were last seen at a Burger King outlet in Pennsylvania on July 29. They were on their way to the Palace of Gold in Marshall County.

Video: MNS workers raze bar in midnight action after Raj Thackeray's fiery speechOver a dozen MNS workers stormed the Night Rider bar in Panvel late Saturday night, vandalising the premises with sticks and causing extensive damage. The incident came hours after Raj Thackeray criticised illegal bars in Raigad during a rally.
Flipkart Freedom Sale: Tablets Get Their Biggest Price Drop of the YearFor buyers looking to invest in a new device, this could be the best chance before the festive season arrives.

Volcano erupts after 600 years: The chain reaction is shaking RussiaOvernight, the Krasheninnikov Volcano in Kamchatka erupted for the first time in 600 years, Russia's RIA state news agency and scientists reported on Sunday.

Another strong earthquake jolts Russia, tsunami waves possibleOvernight, the Krasheninnikov Volcano in Kamchatka erupted for the first time in 600 years, Russia's RIA state news agency and scientists reported on Sunday.

Malegaon case a Congress conspiracy: Sadhvi Pragya gets rousing welcome in BhopalSadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur, a resident of Madhya Pradesh, received a warm welcome as she arrived in Bhopal for the first time after being acquitted in the Malegaon blasts case.

Video: Floodwaters come calling, UP cop performs 'Ganga aarti' at doorstepThe incident happened as both the Ganga and Yamuna rivers breached the danger mark in Prayagraj following incessant rain, inundating several low-lying areas.

Chalti Ka Naam Gaadi: Madhubala and Kishore's defiant dance of joy amidst shadows'Chalti Ka Naam Gaadi' remains a beloved 1958 Bollywood classic starring Madhubala and Kishore Kumar. The film blends humour, music, and family values, reflecting the spirit of post-independence India.

Step inside Hope: Isro's attempt to mimic life on the Moon in LadakhThe mission is a major step in India's preparation for future human spaceflight and interplanetary exploration, including missions to the Moon and Mars.

Pakistan cricket board announces blanket ban on future WCL participationThe Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) on Sunday, August 3, announced that they have introduced a blanket ban on future participation in the World Championship of Legends (WCL). The PCB said that they were unhappy with the conduct of the league during the 2025 edition.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Ticketless passenger destroys computers, threatens staff at Borivali station. Video goes viralA man without a ticket created chaos at Borivali station as he smashed computers and threatened staff. A video of the incident is now going viral.

3 terrorists killed, soldier injured as Operation Akhal in J&K enters Day 3The encounter in the Akhal forest area of south Kashmir began on Friday when a joint team of the Jammu and Kashmir Police, Army and CRPF launched a cordon and search operation.

11 die as car plunges into canal in UP's Gonda, Chief Minister offers condolencesA Bolero carrying 15 passengers lost control and plunged into a canal in Uttar Pradesh's Gonda district, leaving 11 dead.

Odisha girl, set 'ablaze' days ago, dies in Delhi. Then a twist from copsWhile the girl's mother alleged that three individuals were involved in setting her 15-year-old daughter on fire, the Odisha Police said their investigation found no evidence of involvement by anyone else in the incident.

Travelling to Mussoorie? You now need to register to visit the hill stationAs of August 1, all visitors to Mussoorie are required to register online prior to arrival. The move aims to ease traffic, control crowds, and improve services for tourists.

Gauri Khan, Suhana celebrate SRK, Rani and Karan Johar's National Award winShah Rukh Khan won his first National Award for his performance in 'Jawan'. His wife, Gauri Khan and daughter Suhana celebrated SRK, Rani Mukerji and Karan Johar's win at the 71st National Film Awards.

Ex-IITian says India's 'reality' made her go back to US. Viral post sparks debateDr Rajeshwari Iyer had returned to India, hoping to rebuild her life and give back to her homeland. But that hope, she said, soon wore off.

Rajinikanth roasts Coolie director, his self-deprecating jokes win hearts at eventSuperstar Rajinikanth is known for his public speaking skills. At the 'Coolie' audio launch, he made everyone laugh out loud while appreciating and complimenting the cast and crew of the film.

She said in an exclusive with The Lallantop that several mothers told her that their child would eat food only if they heard the song.

Ben Duckett and Ollie Pope held firm early on, but India, led by Shubman Gill, will count on their in-from pace ace Mohammed Siraj for breakthroughs.

Murali Sreeshankar continues magical run after injury, secures 3rd straight titleMurali Sreeshankar secured his third consecutive title at the Qosanov Memorial Athletics Meet after returning from a knee injury. Sreeshankar is aiming to qualify for the World Athletics Championships in September.

Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma, Bumrah headline AB de Villiers's all-time IPL XIAB de Villiers picked a star-studded all-time IPL XI featuring Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, MS Dhoni and more, blending current legends and past greats in a team full of match-winners across generations.

Jason Holder's heroics help West Indies claim last-ball thriller in 2nd T20IJason Holder starred with both ball and bat as West Indies snapped their losing streak against Pakistan in the second T20I. Holder hit the winning runs off the last ball from Shaheen Shah Afridi to level the series heading into the decider.

Frustrated Lionel Messi forced off with injury in Inter Miami vs NecaxaLionel Messi's early injury against Necaxa cast a shadow over Inter Miami's dramatic shootout win, leaving fans anxious as their talisman exited with frustration and a suspected hamstring strain ahead of key fixtures.

Yashasvi Jaiswal enjoyed fun partnership with Akash Deep in Oval TestAfter Day 3 of the Oval Test, Yashasvi Jaiswal said he thoroughly enjoyed his fun and unexpectedly effective partnership with nightwatchman Akash Deep, praising his fearless approach and valuable contribution under pressure.

Living in present: Josh Tongue not thinking about Ashes after fine India seriesDespite picking up 19 wickets in the ongoing England vs India series, Josh Tongue isn't thinking about his chances of making it into the squad for the upcoming Ashes series this year. Tongue said he is focussed on the present at the moment.

Watch: Sunil Gavaskar gifts Shubman Gill signed cap in special Oval gestureIndia legend Sunil Gavaskar gifted Shubman Gill a specially signed cap, offering his support and best wishes ahead of the crucial Day 4 at The Oval, where India aims to level the Test series against England.

Can India defend 374 at The Oval to avoid a series defeat? Here's what history saysENG vs IND, 5th Test: India have set England a formidable target of 374 to win at The Oval in London. However, England have successfully chased down large targets against India in the past, which should give them some confidence.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
